firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to store user information and course registrations. The structure prioritizes authorization independence by leveraging path-based ownership for user data and segregates data based on access requirements.  User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`.  Course registrations are stored under `/users/{userId}/courseRegistrations/{courseRegistrationId}` which ensures that only the user can access their registration data. This design achieves Authorization Independence, since access control relies solely on the `request.auth.uid` matching the `userId` in the path.  It also supports required QAPs since listing course registrations is limited to the user.
